definitions.definition: the fact or condition of functioning or being active.
examples: the construction and operation of power stations
synonyms: action "the slide bars ensure smooth operation"

definitions.definition: an active process; a discharge of a function.

examples: he reopened his operation under a different name

definitions.definition: an activity in which a business is involved.
examples: the company is selling most of its commercial banking operations

definitions.definition: an act of surgery performed on a patient.
examples: surgery, surgical procedure a cardiologist from Atlanta will perform the operation

definitions.definition: a piece of organized and concerted activity involving a number of people, especially members of the armed forces or the police.
preceding a code name for an organized military or police activity.
a process in which a number, quantity, expression, etc., is altered or manipulated according to formal rules, such as those of addition, multiplication, and differentiation.
